Uses of Interface
lighting.ILight

Packages that use ILight
lighting   
scene   
 

Uses of ILight in lighting
 

Classes in lighting that implement ILight
 class AbstractLight
          This abstract class holds all the shared functionality for all lights.
 class AreaLight
          This class represents an area light (like point light but it has a area which is not zero).
 class DirectionalLight
          This class represents a directional light source (like the sun).
 class HemisphericalLight
          This class represents a hemispherical light source (light which comes from the sky and ground).
 class PointLight
          This class represents a point light.
 

Methods in lighting that return types with arguments of type ILight
 java.util.Iterator<ILight> ILight.getIterator()
          Returns an iterator for the light source.
 java.util.Iterator<ILight> AreaLight.getIterator()
          Returns an iterator for the light source.
 java.util.Iterator<ILight> AbstractLight.getIterator()
          Returns an iterator for the light source.
 

Uses of ILight in scene
 

Fields in scene declared as ILight
private  ILight SceneParser.curLight
           
 

Fields in scene with type parameters of type ILight
private  java.util.List<ILight> Scene.lights
           
 

Methods in scene that return types with arguments of type ILight
 java.util.List<ILight> Scene.getLightsList()
          Returns the lights list in the scene.
 

Methods in scene with parameters of type ILight
 double Scene.getSL(IRay ray, ILight light, Intersection hitPoint)
          Returns 0 if the given ray from a hit point to a light source intersects with other objects (blocked), or 1 otherwise (not blocked).
